Steps.Message: It's Demi here and I will be taking over from James this afternoon to personally keep you up to date with the latest information from site. In the meantime if you want to speak to us, you can contact us via Facebook or on Twitter @UKPowernetworks where the team I work on will be happy to help 24/7.

We became aware of a power cut at 11:00. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Power cut reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Engineers investigating and fixing

Logs.Comment: It's Demi here and I will be taking over from James this afternoon to personally keep you up to date with the latest information from site. In the meantime if you want to speak to us, you can contact us via Facebook or on Twitter @UKPowernetworks where the team I work on will be happy to help 24/7.

UKPNIncident.PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We had to turn off power in your area so our engineers could safely carry out emergency repairs to the network.
